text.0: full wise is he who hath discerned let him speak to us of the gods.
text.1: the man whose praisesongs varuṇa the beautiful or mitra loves.
text.2: for they are kings of noblest might of glorious fame most widely spread.
text.3: lords of the brave who strengthen law the holy ones with every race.
text.4: approaching you with prayer for aid together i address you first.
text.5: we who have good steeds call on you most sage to give us strength besides.
text.6: een out of misery mitra gives a way to dwelling at our case.
text.7: for he who worships hath the grace of mitra fighter in the van.
text.8: in mitras shelter that extends to utmost distance may we dwell.
text.9: unmenaced guarded by the care ever as sons of varuṇa.
text.10: ye mitra urge this people on and to one end direct their ways.
text.11: neglect not ye the wealthy chiefs neglect not us the Ṛṣis be our guardians when ye quaff the milk.
